Steps.Description: Analyzing the HTML source code reveals default credentials.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The default credentials can be used to bypass authentication and access additional information.
StepDetails.Action: Use the default credentials to log in.
StepDetails.Result: The User-Agent and an image are displayed.

Steps.Description: Attempt to alter the User-Agent during authentication.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: Modifying the User-Agent may lead to a SQL injection vulnerability.
StepDetails.Action: Send a POST request with a modified User-Agent.
StepDetails.Result: A SQL error is displayed, indicating a potential SQL injection vulnerability.

Steps.Description: Attempt to leak the database name using an error-based approach.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: Using the Updatexml() function in the User-Agent payload can cause an error and reveal the database name.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a SQL payload with the Updatexml() function to leak the database name.
StepDetails.Result: The database name is leaked in the SQL error response.
